tit.e: Gozan (a term related to Zen temples)

sen.j: 五山（ござん）とは、中国・日本における禅林（禅宗寺院）の格式であり、十刹・諸山の上。
sen.e: Gozan indicates the status of Zenrin (a temple of the Zen sect) in China and Japan that is ranked above jissatsu (for ten important temples of the Rinzai sect) and shozan (for ordinary Zen temples).

Gozan indicates the status of a Zenrin (temple of the Zen sect) in China and Japan that is ranked above jissatsu (for the ten important temples of the Rinzai sect) and shozan (for ordinary Zen temples).

sen.j: 元は南宋の寧宗_(宋)がインドの5精舎10塔所（天竺五精舎）の故事に倣って径山・雲隠・天童・浄慈・育王の5寺を「五山」として保護を与えたのが由来と言われている。
sen.e: The term is said originated in that Neiso in Southern Sung Dynasty protected the five temples of Keizan, Unin, Tendo, Joji, and Ikuo as "gozan" (literally, five mountains), after the historical fact of five Shoja and ten pagodas (five Shoja in India) in India).

The term is said to have originated from the fact that Neiso of the Southern Sung Dynasty protected the five temples of Keizan, Unin, Tendo, Joji, and Ikuo as "gozan" (literally, five mountains), in emulation of India's five Shoja and ten pagodas (The Five Shoja of India).

sen.j: 鎌倉時代後期には日本にも禅宗の普及に伴って広まるようになった。
sen.e: In the latter half of the Kamakura period, temples with the gozan status appeared in Japan aw well, corresponding to an increase in the number of believers of Zen principles.

sen.j: 正安元年（1299年）には鎌倉幕府執権北条貞時が浄智寺を「五山」とするように命じたのが日本における最古と伝わる。
sen.e: It is said that the oldest temple with this status was Jochi-ji Temple, which was ordered by Regent Sadatoki HOJO of the Kamakura bakufu in 1299 to have the status of "gozan."

sen.j: 鎌倉幕府の五山制度については詳細は明らかではないものの、鎌倉の建長寺・円覚寺・寿福寺及び京都の建仁寺の4ヶ寺が「五山」に含まれていたと考えられている。
sen.e: The details of the gozan system of the Kamakura bakufu are not known clearly, but it is considered that the four temples of Kencho-ji Temple, Enkaku-ji Temple and Jufuku-ji Temple in Kamakura and Kennin-ji Temple in Kyoto were included in the "gozan" temples.

sen.j: 同様に後醍醐天皇の建武の新政においても「五山」が制定され、南禅寺と大徳寺の両寺が五山の筆頭とされ、東福寺と建仁寺が含まれていた。
sen.e: Similarly, "gozan" temples were specified in Kemmu Restoration by Emperor Godaigo as well, and included Nanzen-ji Temple, Daitoku-ji Temple, Tofuku-ji Temple and Kennin-ji Temple, with the first two temples placed at the head of them.

sen.j: その後、室町幕府を開いた足利尊氏は、天竜寺を建立したが、天竜寺を五山に加えることを望んだ。
sen.e: Later, Takauji ASHIKAGA, who established the Muromachi bakufu, built Tenryu-ji Temple and wanted the temple to be added to the gozan temples.

sen.e: For this, the Northern Court (in Japan) issued inzen (a decree from the retired Emperor) in 1341 to entrust to Takauji the selection of gozan temples.

sen.j: これに応えて同年に尊氏は第一位に南禅寺・建長寺、第二位に円覚寺・天竜寺、第三位に寿福寺（鎌倉）・第四位に建仁寺（京都）・第五位に東福寺（京都）・准五山（次席）に浄智寺（鎌倉）を選定した。
sen.e: Then in the same year, Takauji selected Nanzen-ji Temple and Kencho-ji Temple for the first grade gozan, Enkaku-ji Temple and Tenryu-ji Temple for the second grade gozan, Jufuku-ji Temple (in Kamakkura) for the third grade gozan, Kennin-ji Temple (in Kyoto) for the fourth grade gozan, Tofuku-ji Temple for the fifth grade gozan, and Jochi-ji Temple (in Kamakura) for the quasi-gozan (ranked next to the temples described above).

sen.j: これ以後、五山の決定及びその住持の任免権は足利氏征夷大将軍個人に帰するという慣例が成立することになる。
sen.e: After this, it became customary that the right to specify a gozan temple and to appoint/dismiss the chief priest of such a temple was attributed to the seii taishogun (literally, "great general who is to subdue the barbarians") of Ashikaga clan himself.

sen.e: Later in 1358, Yoshiakira ASHIKAGA, the second shogun, revised the above specification, and raised the grade of Jochi-ji Temple to the fifth gozan.

sen.j: ところが、義満が足利将軍家の菩提寺として相国寺を建立すると、至徳 (日本)3年7月10日_(旧暦)（1386年）に義堂周信・絶海中津らの意見を容れて五山制度の大改革を断行、南禅寺を「五山の上」として全ての禅林の最高位とする代わりに相国寺を「五山」に入れ、更に五山を京都五山と鎌倉五山に分割した。
sen.e: However, after building Shokoku-ji Temple as his family temple, Yoshimitsu reformed the gozan system drastically on July 10 (in the old calendar) in 1336 taking into account of opinions of Shushin GIDO, Chushin ZEKKAI and others in the following way: "The status above gozan" should be given to Nanzen-ji Temple, placing the temple at the highest rank of all Zen temples, and instead of that, Sokoku-ji Temple should be included in the gozan temples, and furthermore, the gozan status was divided into Kyoto gozan and Kamakura gozan.
